title: Hiragana & Katakana Chart
subtitle: Complete reference guide for all basic Japanese kana characters
aboutText: This comprehensive chart displays all 46 basic Hiragana and Katakana characters with their romanization. Hiragana is used for native Japanese words, while Katakana is primarily used for foreign loanwords, names, and emphasis.
howToUse1: Click the tabs above to switch between Hiragana and Katakana
howToUse2: Each cell shows the Japanese character (large) and its romanization (small)
howToUse3: Use this as a quick reference while learning or practicing
howToUse4: Press Ctrl+P (or âŒ˜+P on Mac) to print or save as PDF for offline use
practiceText: Head to our interactive training modes to practice these characters! Try Pick Mode for recognition, Input Mode for recall, or Blitz Mode for speed challenges.
